author: ajsutton
content:
Not sure of the details of this one but typically issues on Görli are because there's a liveness failure in Clique which can occur where there are multiple forks with equal total difficulty and the signers split fairly evenly between them - then no signer can produce a block because they've produced one recently but all the other signers are on the other fork with the same problem.  Given there was talk of signers resyncing the chain that's usually how it gets solved.

There's been a proposal around to fix this for quite some time but it hasn't gotten any traction.  It probably doesn't matter too much now as Görli will move over to PoS so we won't have any testnets using Clique (and private networks are likely better off using QBFT).
